subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More from Mr. Boooooor---------ring?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I used to put in a "range" and "center" control on the older boxes for that 
purpoe, but no one ever used it, so I started leaving it out.

About that noise, I didn't think, but the smoke detectors, floresent lights, 
and who knows what else, in large buildings puts out a horrendous amout of 
RF interference. I doubt if there is any way to filter that out without 
losing all reception.

I call it boring cuz that's pretty much my life, I never get out.

Frank-S

>From: William Murphy <vilhellm@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More from Mr. Boooooor---------ring?
>Date: Sat, 25 Aug 2007 21:13:39 -0700 (PDT)
>
>Frank, It's not boring I promise. For everyone here that follows your work 
>it's exciting to watch where this is going. Question, is there a manual 
>over ride so the linear tune function be parked on a station? I know this 
>isn't the purpose but it could be a plus. -Bill
>
>Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:                            
>    This is the latest printed board I just now ordered. If anyone wants to 
>see
>  it you have to download the PCBExpress software at www.PCBexpress.com. 
>The
>  silk screen markings are for assembly purposes, and won't be on this 
>order,
>  so I didn't care if there was some over lap. There's no way to mark the
>  layout underside components, but I have my notes for that. All components
>  are from mouser.com.
>
>  Even though the layout is labled "RVG", it is in fact linear and random, 
>AM
>  and FM, with stereo input and output (except for the monitor speaker). 
>There
>  is provision for both wire, and bar antennas. The board was made extra
>  copmpact to reduce cost, I wanted to keep the two boards under $100, the
>  cost was about $93. With silk screen and solder mask, they would have 
>been
>  double.
>
>  After endless hours staring at the screen, my eys are about fried, I have 
>a
>  spot in the right eye, that hopefully will clear up.
>
>  Butttttt Boring Frank
>
